main_text:
Epistemic Utility Arguments concerning Outright Beliefs || Dominance and Consistency
4.1 Dominance and Consistency

So, with all this in hand, the argument for Consistency\(_2\) runs as
follows:


Epistemic Conservatism \(W \gt R \gt 0\).

Dominance If one option strongly dominates another,
rationality requires you not to choose the second.

Therefore,

Consistency\(_2\) If two propositions cannot both be
true together, rationality requires that you should not believe
both.
entry_title: Epistemic Utility Arguments for Epistemic Norms
